name: YouTube Remote Controller
short_description:
Boot your PC with YouTube Remote Controller: you will enjoy a full-screen YouTube view which can be remote controlled by your smartphone or another PC in the local network (no application installation required, just use the browser).

YouTube Remote Controller is a "live" (no installation required), browser-only Linux distribution, suitable for USB keys, CD-ROMs and even virtual machine use.

In order to write the downloaded ISO file onto an USB stick, Windows users can use Win32DiskImager, while Linux and OSX users can make use of dd (not UNetbootin).

Suitable for home use, parties or cafes, once loaded and connected to the Internet, the operating system will display the IP address to which connect your mobile browser: you will be able to control YouTube, selecting a song, altering the volume and shutting down the PC by your phone!
summary: An operating system which displays a remote controlled YouTube view
